Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal text: 7 ll. of demotic and 1 l. of Greek on recto, list of 16 witnesses on verso. Dated year 51 (the year is preserved only by the Greek docket) Payni 3 of Ptolemy Euergetes II. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Cession of a half share of all his property by Pasy called Amon-pion son of Zeho to Tawe daughter of Zeho his elder sister. scribe. Necht(?)-p-hm son of Hor". P BM 10398.1-2 are the two halves of the same papyrus, mounted in two separate frames (.2 is the right half, .1 the left half).
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (2734) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/2734)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fractured Black ink Backed: brown paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Sandwich: board Binding: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: good
